title: Angular impulse - direction of J for spinning disk

content.question: A disk is spinning counterclockwise, when a clockwise torque is applied for a short time. In which direction is the angular impulse delivered to the disk? What reasoning supports the claim?

choices.label: Counterclockwise. The angular impulse has the same direction as the angular velocity.
Counterclockwise. When an object’s rotational motion is slowing down, the angular impulse has the opposite direction as the torque.
Clockwise. The angular impulse has the same direction as the torque.
Clockwise. When an object’s rotational motion is slowing down, the angular impulse has the same direction as the angular displacement.

content.answer: Clockwise. The angular impulse has the same direction as the torque.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems
